chapter.title: Module
chapter.para: The , also known as Reports, is the cross-product central module of enabling you,as a user at a client, to browse through all the acknowledgements or notifications sent by the bank, or through consolidated lists of pending transactions or existing records for the Import Letters of Credit issued, Shipping Guarantees, Financing Requests, Export Letters of Credit, Export/Import Collections or Fund Transfers notified.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. Some functions are similar to the Pending, Inquiry, and Maintenance functions as described in the chapter Functions, but they show transactions for all products.

listitem.para: Review all transactional messages sent by the bank, whether acknowledgements to transaction events initiated by the client, new events reported by the bank's back-office on an existing record, or new notifications. The details of each transaction event can also be retrieved from the list.

section.title: Review Reporting
section.para: Display a list of all transactional messages sent by the bank, for all products.
After you click Search, the following information is presented:

entry.para: Unique reference number generated by for this transaction.
Bank's internal reference number assigned by the bank's back office to this transaction.

listitem.para: New (for an initiation of LC, SG, TF, BG, EC, SI or FT, or a notification of EL, IC or SR)
Amend (for an amendment of LC or BG)
Message (for any of the free format / update message available with all the products)

Reporting (when the transaction event has not been initiated by the client as opposed to the three previous ones and is therefore an update message initiated and sent by the bank on a given transaction record).

entry.para: Name of the beneficiary for an Import LC, an Issued Standby LC, a Banker's Guarantee or a Fund Transfer, the name of the Transportation Company for a Shipping Guarantee, the name of the applicant for an EL or a Received Standby LC, the name of the drawee for an Export Collection, the drawer for an Import Collection; or the remitter for an Inward Remittance. Empty for a Financing which does not handle a counterparty.
The three-digits currency code of the transaction record.
Transaction amount, that is, the amount involved in the current event. This column therefore contains:

listitem.para: The total amount of the file upon its creation (i.e. when the transaction type is New),
Only the increase or decrease of amount for an Amendment of LC or BG,
A blank value in all other cases, since no amount is associated with other types of event.

entry.para: Date when the customer initially released the transaction event to the bank.

section.para:
Click the action icon
by a transaction event to display its full details. This opens a popup window with two sections:

listitem.para: The top of the page contains the summary information of the event and is common across the various products.
It is composed of a first section summarising the event details (such as its dates, its references and amount).

A second optional section shows additional details provided by the input user when preparing the transaction event. It is here that the free format text or an optional file attachment isshown if the transaction event was a free format / update message.

And finally a third section shows the details of the actual reporting message as created by the bank and the updated product status for the transaction after this event, plus any comments or the bank's attachments.
The Reporting Status in the popup shows whether the event has been successfully acknowledged by the bank and accordingly what is its updated state.
The possible values of the product status have already been shown in the chapters on the Inquiry functions for the various products. As a reminder, they are:
Rejected indicates that the related event has not been approved by the bank,
New indicates the state of any product after its successful initiation,
Amended is only applicable a Commercial or Standby Letter of Credit or a Banker's Guarantee after its successful amendment,
Updated is the generic state generally given by the bank as a follow-up to a free format message transaction,
Purged is set by the bank to notify its technical termination of a given record,
Other statuses can be freely used by the bank with eventually its own interpretations (Accepted, Settled, Cancelled and Extended).

The rest of the page beyond the horizontal separator shows the most recently updated detailed information on the transaction record as validated by the bank through its reporting. It is specific to each product. See the chapters on the individual product modules for further details on the names used to describe each field.

section.para: You can print out the whole content of the popup window if required.

section.title: Pending Transactions
section.para: As described in chapter Functions, but shows transactions for all products.

section.title: Batch Submission
section.para: Display a list of all unsigned transactions, for all products.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with the list of items which have been successfully sent to the bank, next to the list of the records pending from an additional validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Report Execution
section.para: Execute a report designed by an authorized administrator.
This function displays a list of all available reports.

Click the Report Name to display the selected report. The report may provide a criteria zone, so that you can enter search patterns. You can also select the output format: Screen, CSV export, SpreadSheet (Excel) export or PDF export. Click Search to execute the report.
